paper_abstract: This paper considers system identification using domain partition based continuous piecewise linear neural network (DP-CPLNN), which is newly proposed. DP-CPLNN has the capability of representing any continuous piecewise linear (CPWL) function, hence its identification performance can be expected. Another attractive feature of DP-CPLNN is the geometrical property of its parameters. Applying this property, this paper proposes an identification method including domain partition and parameter training. In numerical experiments, DP-CPLNN with this method outperforms hinging hyperplanes and high-level canonical piecewise linear representation, which are two widely used CPWL models, showing the flexibility of DP-CPLNN and the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm in nonlinear identification. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Nonlinear system identification with continuous piecewise linear neural network
